comments.body: Always impressing to see support for this kind of thing.
I think it would be better to move jmh tests to their corresponding (`mqtt` and `mqttStreaming`) projects.
I believe that they must be in their own sub project given code generation. Do I have that wrong? I recall reading something to that effect from the sbt-jmh doc.

Ahh, you are right. sbt-jmh does indeed say that. Lets leave it as it is now then. Probably in the future we will want one project for all benchmarks. Otherwise it will end up with a cambrian explosion of benchmark projects.

comments.body: Is there a reason why you switched off `parallelExecution`? Could making sure to use unique names per Test/Spec make it support parallel execution?

Using parallel execution is problematic here because  I run FlowSpec in the same Couchbase bucket on the same dataset. So running updatebulk and deletebulk tests simultaneously would cause the problem, due to the Couchbase Optimistic locking nature. In my opinion, creating every time new dataset with different ids for 19 different unit tests will produce a lot of code bloat.  all couchbase test suite runs for 17 seconds form which about 15 seconds take to initiate full couchbase cluster with buckets and indexing services and  which is required for running  "Source from query" specs.
